title: 2 Simple Ways to Get Bus Directions on Google Maps

steps.title: Open the Google Maps app.
steps.content: Open the Google Maps app. This looks like a multicolored pin. Make sure you have location services turned on for this app.

steps.title: Search for a destination.
steps.content: Search for a destination. You can insert an address or name in the field at the top, or tap and drag the map around to manually find a location. When you do, tap it. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Directions.
steps.content: Tap Directions . This will be underneath the location's name.

steps.title: Enter the starting location.
steps.content: Enter the starting location. This can be your address or your nearest bus stop.

steps.title: Tap the bus icon.
steps.content: Tap the bus icon. This is usually next to the car and walking icon. You'll find this below the start and end location. A list of bus routes will load at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Select a bus route.
steps.content: Select a bus route. If you have multiple routes available, tap it to select it. You can see the bus number, estimated time of arrival, estimated duration, and fees.

steps.title: Tap Start.
steps.content: Tap Start . This will begin your navigation. If you aren't already at the nearest bus stop, start walking now. You can see your route at the bottom half of your screen. To expand it, drag the top of the menu upwards.

steps.title: Go to https://maps.google.com/ in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://maps.google.com/ in a web browser. If you want to see your saved locations and pins, log into your Google account .

steps.title: Search for a destination.
steps.content: Search for a destination. You can type an address or name in the field at the top, or click and drag the map around to manually find a location. When you do, click it.

steps.title: Click Directions.
steps.content: Click Directions . This will be underneath the location's name.

steps.title: Enter the starting location.
steps.content: Enter the starting location. This can be your address or your nearest bus stop.

steps.title: Click the bus icon.
steps.content: Click the bus icon. This is usually next to the car and walking icon. You'll find this above the start and end location. A list of bus routes will load in the left panel.

steps.title: Select a bus route.
steps.content: Select a bus route. If you have multiple routes available, click it to select it. You can see the bus number, estimated time of arrival, estimated duration, and fees.

steps.title: View your route.
steps.content: View your route. The navigation will open with the route. If needed, you can print the map to take with you. Keep in mind that the bus schedule may change due to weather conditions or construction. It's recommended to use the mobile app as this updates automatically.
